001package edu.pdx.cs.joy.whitlock;
002
003import edu.pdx.cs.joy.lang.Human;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006
007/**
008 * This class represents a <code>Student</code>.
009 */
010public class Student extends Human {
011
012  private final double gpa;
013
014  /**
015   * Creates a new <code>Student</code>
016   *
017   * @param name
018   *        The student's name
019   * @param classes
020   *        The names of the classes the student is taking.  A student
021   *        may take zero or more classes.
022   * @param gpa
023   *        The student's grade point average
024   * @param gender
025   *        The student's gender ("male", "female", or "other", case-insensitive)
026   */
027  public Student(String name, ArrayList<String> classes, double gpa, String gender) {
028    super(name);
029    validateGPA(gpa);
030    this.gpa = gpa;
031  }
032
033  private void validateGPA(double gpa) {
034    if (gpa < 0.0) {
035      throw new InvalidGPAException(gpa);
036    }
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * All students say "This class is too much work"
041   */
042  @Override
043  public String says() {
044    return "This class is too much work";
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Returns a <code>String</code> that describes this
049   * <code>Student</code>.
050   */
051  public String toString() {
052    return this.getName() + " has a GPA of " + gpa;
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Main program that parses the command line, creates a
057   * <code>Student</code>, and prints a description of the student to
058   * standard out by invoking its <code>toString</code> method.
059   */
060  public static void main(String[] args) {
061    if (args.length == 0) {
062      System.err.println("Missing required student information!!");
063      return;
064    }
065
066    String name = args[0];
067    double gpa;
068    try {
069      gpa = Double.parseDouble(args[1]);
070
071    } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
072      System.err.println("Invalid GPA: \"" + args[1] + "\"");
073      return;
074    }
075
076    Student student = new Student(name, new ArrayList<>(), gpa, "other");
077    System.out.println(student);
078  }
079
080  public static class InvalidGPAException extends RuntimeException {
081    private final double invalidGPA;
082
083    public InvalidGPAException(double gpa) {
084      super(String.format("Invalid GPA: %f", gpa));
085      this.invalidGPA = gpa;
086    }
087
088    public double getInvalidGPA() {
089      return invalidGPA;
090    }
091  }
092
093}
